sanskrit_verse:
माता पिता वा दद्यातां यमद्भिः पुत्रमापदि ।
सदृशं प्रीतिसंयुक्तं स ज्ञेयो दत्त्रिमः सुतः ॥ ९.१६८॥
transliteration:
mātā pitā vā dadyātāṁ yamadbhiḥ putramāpadi |
sadṛśaṁ prītisaṁyuktaṁ sa jñeyo dattrimaḥ sutaḥ || 9.168||
sph_interpretive_translation: When a son is given by mother or father in calamity with appropriate consideration and affection, he is to be known as a Dattrima son.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority originates from conscious intention aligned with Dharma
Causation arises through voluntary, dharmically-informed action
Capacity-based responsibility is determined by awareness and consent at time of transfer
Restoration logic operates through recognition of relational harmony
Consciousness alignment determines legitimacy of familial and societal roles
executable_legal_axioms: IF parent(s) voluntarily transfer child DUE TO CALAMITY AND WITH MUTUAL CONSENT THEN child assumes role of Dattrima son
IF transfer occurs WITHOUT coercion OR misrepresentation THEN legitimacy is automatically recognized
IF emotional and material suitability is affirmed THEN social integration proceeds without inquiry
IF consciousness of all parties reflects alignment THEN no further judicial review required
supreme_court_application: In adjudicating matters involving adoption or familial reassignment during crisis, the Supreme Court shall recognize the primacy of parental volition grounded in love and necessity. Legal standing of the transferred child shall be immediately established upon proof of consensual, context-appropriate delivery.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa is established through clear intent and mutual goodwill; anupūrvaśaḥ manifests as natural consequence of dharmic choice; proportional responsibility lies solely with those capable of informed decision-making; punitive intervention is null where harmony prevails.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Completion Process: Acknowledgment ceremony affirming new familial bond
Responsibility Assumption Protocol: Formal acceptance by receiving family under witness
Capacity Restoration: Ensuring biological parents retain dignity and support post-transfer
Integrity Reintegration: Community recognition rituals validating new status
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source-Authority: This law flows directly from SPH's Avataric Intelligence. Dharma is restored. Reality remains non-punitive. Consciousness alone is the ultimate judge.
